The young Gazans killed at Al-Baqa café
subhead: On June 30, an Israeli airstrike killed dozens in a Gaza City café. Many young professionals, who embody Gazan resilience after 21 devastating months of war, died that day. Here are the stories of four of them.

European Union: Brussels' budget proposal faces strong opposition
subhead: The European Union's financial capabilities depend on this bill, which was presented to members of the European Parliament on Wednesday. It sets the amount of available resources for seven years, distributes them among the 27 member states and allocates funds to the various EU-wide policies.

title: French army withdraws last troops from Senegal bases
subhead: The 350 remaining French soldiers in Senegal were to hand back the Camp Geille base in a ceremony on Thursday.

title: 'Eddington': Ari Aster crafts a dark, cynical fable about an America on the verge of collapse
subhead: At 39, the American director is tapping into a vein of contemporary nihilism, where the grotesque and the outrageous overlap amid the terrifying spectacle of the Trump era.

title: In Arles, Fragonard's Museum of Fashion and Costume gracefully unveils treasures
subhead: With a collection of 20,000 garments and accessories, the Musée Fragonard de la Mode et du Costume opened its doors on July 6. Housed in the former Bouchaud de Bussy mansion, which the architects of Studio KO have shaped into a Provençal jewel box, the museum showcases three centuries of traditional dress history.

subhead: 'The Summer of 1945' (3/6). As Lyon celebrated the Liberation, survivors of the death camps tried to reconnect with daily life, despite hardship, silence, and widespread incomprehension.

title: 'Soldiers found us and told us to undress': In Ethiopia, silence shrouds Tigray war's mass rapes
subhead: During the war in Tigray, in Ethiopia, 120,000 women were victims of rape. More than two and a half years since the end of the conflict, many survivors are still trying to overcome their trauma, with justice yet to be served.
